intro: Corchorus malchairii, commonly known as the Malchair's spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in arid regions. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in traditional medicine or as a decorative plant in gardens.
